# City Resilience Profiling Tool

## Types of Questions
_... that our tool should be able to answer_

* What are the highest risks (i.e. that cause most impact)?
* Which elements and components of the city are affected by floods?
* What are the indicators (i.e. data) relate to the elements affected by floods?
* What are alternatives that would change the risks (i.e. counterfactuals)?
* What is the relationship between shocks (chain of events
* What are the 2nd or 3rd level effects of a flood?

## Ontology

![](https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1CSUIXswH4le2zXR8OjhAMw1iUd-Nann9)


## Use Case from a real city

* Flooding is a well known problem in the city.
* Around 50% of indicators collected.
* Some data on historical significant shock impacts.
* Interest of the city is economy.
* Following the interest of the city, first assessment would focus on 18 economy indicators and 8 mobility indicators as the base for providing recommendations for action.

Additional analysis using the knowledge graph:

* Impact of flooding showing relevance over the economy of the city
* Impact of shocks triggered by flood 
* Impact of all these shocks over all the urban elements
Initial exercise: see the occurrences of flooding over total number of shock impacts

// Helper relations - not part of the discussions during the main demo

def shock_type_name_to_shock_subtype_name(stn, sstn) = 
  from_shock_type_name(stn, st) and
  from_shock_subtype_name(sstn, sst) and
  shock_subtype_belongs_to_shock_type(sst, st)
  from sst, st

def shock_subtype_name_to_shock_impact(sstn, s) = 
  shock_subtype_to_impact(sst, s) and
  from_shock_subtype_name(sstn, sst)
  from sst

def shock_subtype_name_to_affected_urban_element(sstn, e) = 
  from_shock_subtype_name(sstn, sst) and
  shock_impact_subtype(s, sst) and
  shock_impact_affected_urban_elements(s, e)
  from sst, s

def shock_type_name_to_affected_urban_element(stn, e) = 
  from_shock_type_name(stn, st) and
  shock_type_contains_shock_subtype(st, sst) and
  shock_impact_subtype(s, sst) and
  shock_impact_affected_urban_elements(s, e)
  from sst, st, s

def shock_type_name_to_shock_impact = 
  shock_type_name_to_shock_subtype_name . shock_subtype_name_to_shock_impact

def indicator_to_prioritymatter_name(i, pmn) = 
  indicator_prioritymatter(i, pm) and 
  prioritymatter:priority_matter(pm, pmn) 
  from pm

def indicator_to_shock_subtype_name(i, sstn) = 
  indicator_shock_subtype(i, sst) and
  from_shock_subtype_name(sstn, sst)
  from sst

def stress_name_to_urban_element_name(strn, uen) = 
  (stress_from_name . stress_urban_element_code)(strn, uec) and
  urban_element_code(ue, uec) and
  urban_element_name(ue, uen)
  from ue, uec
